1: I am a man who has seen misery under the rod of Yahweh's fury.\q
2: He drove me away and caused me to walk in darkness rather than light.\q
3: Surely he turned his hand against me again and again, the whole day long. \q
4:
He made my flesh and my skin waste away; he broke my bones.

\q
5: He built up siege works against me, and surrounded me with bitterness and hardship.\q
6: He made me live in dark places, like those who died long ago.\q
7: He built a wall around me and I cannot escape. He made my chains heavy\q
8:
and though I call out and cry for help, he shut out my prayer.

\q
9: He blocked my path with a wall of hewn stone; he made my paths crooked.\q
10: He is like a bear waiting to ambush me, a lion in hiding;\q
11:
he turned aside my paths, he has made me desolate.

\q
12: He bent his bow and set me as a target for his arrow.\q
13: He pierced my kidneys with the arrows of his quiver.\q
14: I became a laughingstock to all my people, the object of their taunting all day long.\q
15:
He filled me with bitterness and forced me to drink wormwood.

\q
16: He crushed my teeth with gravel; he has pushed me down into the dust.\q
17: My soul is deprived of peace; I have forgotten what happiness is.\q
18:
So I say, "My endurance has perished and so has my hope in Yahweh."

\q
19: Remember my affliction and my wanderings, the wormwood and bitterness.\q
20: I continually remember it and I am bowed down within me.\q
21:
But I call this to mind and therefore I have hope:

\q
22: The steadfast love of Yahweh never ceases and his compassions never end,\q
23: they are new every morning; your faithfulness is great.\q
24:
"Yahweh is my inheritance," I said, therefore I will hope in him.

\q
25: Yahweh is good to those who wait for him, to the one who seeks him.\q
26: It is good to wait silently for the salvation of Yahweh.\q
27: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.\q
28: Let him sit alone in silence, when it is laid upon him.\q
29:
Let him put his mouth in the dust—there may yet be hope.

\q
30: Let him offer his cheek to the one who strikes him, and let him be filled to the full with reproach.\q
31: For the Lord will not reject us forever,\q
32: but though he causes grief, he will have compassion according to the abundance of his steadfast love.\q
33:
For he does not afflict from his heart or torment the children of mankind.

\q
34: To crush underfoot all the prisoners of the earth,\q
35: to deny a man justice in the presence of the Most High,\q
36:
to deny justice to a person—the Lord would not approve such things!

\q
37: Who has spoken and it came to pass, unless the Lord decreed it?\q
38: Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that both calamities and the good come?\q
39:
How can any person alive complain? How can a person complain about the punishment for his sins?

\q
40: Let us examine our ways and test them, and let us return to Yahweh.\q
41: Let us lift up our hearts and our hands to God in the heavens:\q
42: "We have transgressed and rebelled, and you have not forgiven.\q
43:
You have covered yourself with anger and pursued us, you have killed and you have not spared. 
\q
44: You have covered yourself with a cloud so that no prayer can pass through.\q
45: You have made us like filthy scum and refuse among the nations.\q
47:
panic and pitfall have come upon us, ruin and destruction.

\q
48: My eyes flow with streams of tears because my people are destroyed.\q
49: My eyes will shed tears without ceasing, without relief,\q
50:
until Yahweh from heaven looks down and sees. 

\q
51: My eyes cause me grief because of all the daughters of my city.\q
52: I have been hunted like a bird by those who were my enemies; they hunted me without a reason.\q
53: They cast me into a pit and they threw a stone on me,\q
54:
and they caused waters to overflow, covering my head. I said, 'I have been cut off!'

\q
55: I called on your name, Yahweh, from the depths of the pit.\q
56: You heard my voice when I said, 'Do not close your ear to my cry for help.'\q
57:
You came near on the day I called on you; you said, 'Do not fear.'

\q
58: Lord, you defended my case, you saved my life!\q
59: Yahweh, you have seen the wrong they have done to me; judge my case.\q
60: You have seen their insults, all their plots against me—\q
61:
You have heard their scorn, Yahweh, and all their plans regarding me.

\q
62: The lips and the accusations of my enemies come against me all the day.\q
63:
Look at how they sit and then rise up; they mock me with their songs.
\q
64: Pay back to them, Yahweh, according to what they have done.\q
65: You will let their hearts be shameless! May your condemnation be upon them!\q
66: You pursue them in anger and destroy them from under the heavens, Yahweh!"
